subject: Negotiation
title: Yahoo Rejects Microsoft's $44.6 Billion Offer
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Yahoo Rejects Microsoft's $44.6 Billion Offer.

hook.text: In 2008, Microsoft offered $44.6 billion for Yahoo. Yahoo's CEO said no. Yahoo later sold for $4.8 billion.

buildup.text: Jerry Yang believed Yahoo was worth far more and held out for a higher price that never came.

discovery.text: While Yang waited, Google's dominance grew, Yahoo's market share collapsed, and the board turned against him.

twist.text: Yang was forced to resign. Eight years later, Verizon bought Yahoo's core business for 89% less.

climax.text: Overvaluing your position while the market moves against you is a classic negotiation trap.

punchline.text: The best deal isn't the perfect one. It's the best available right now.

quiz.question: Why was Yahoo's rejection of Microsoft considered a disaster?
options: Yahoo eventually sold for 89% less than Microsoft offered
